title: Walt Disney CFO, Others, Brought Concerns to Board Over Bob Chapek
description: CFO Christine McCarthy brought her concerns to the board after a calamitous November earnings call.

title: Twitter Lays Off Some Sales Employees After They Committed to Twitter 2.0
description: The new cuts follow mass layoffs and resignations since Elon Musk took over the social-media platform.

title: Disney, Other Streaming Giants Confront Slowing Subscriber Growth
description: Rivals abound, creating compelling content is expensive and consumers are increasingly willing to jump from service to service.

title: Disabled Shoppers Struggle With Inaccessible Self-Checkouts
description: Stores’ self-checkout machines can annoy shoppers with error messages about unexpected items in the bagging area and other hiccups. But for some disabled people, they are often unusable.

title: NASA's Orion Spacecraft Makes Close Approach to Moon During Artemis Flight
description: The ship was just 81 miles above the moon following a critical engine maneuver Monday, and a 230,000-mile trip since launching last week

title: How Elon Musk's Twitter Faces Mountain of Debt, Falling Revenue and Surging Costs
description: The social-media company is working to bring down expenses as many advertisers pause spending and debt payments loom.

title: FTX Founder Was Among Biggest Political Donors
description: Sam Bankman-Fried of the collapsed crypto exchange focused on contributing to Democrats, while a fellow executive largely backed Republicans.

title: Amazon Has a Problem: Consumers Don't Love It as Much as They Used To
description: Shipping delays and customer service complaints are among the woes that have started to erode shoppers’ long-favorable views.

title: Domino's Pizza Invests in Electric-Vehicle Fleet to Help Stores Recruit Drivers
description: The world’s biggest pizza chain signs a deal with General Motors to purchase EVs. The company’s sales have suffered due to too few drivers.

title: FTX Crypto Customers Worry They Will Never See Their Money Again
description: Optimistic at first that they would get their money back, they are now increasingly losing hope.
